TopicTitle: Noodle Rocket Ballet--my weirdest rocket yet

Articles.Content:
Someone might want an explanation. *ahem*

So. From the Kerbal Space Program community on Google+--and thanks to Monkeysee in particular--I learned that fuel lines are strong like struts, but flexible like bungee cords.

And another member of that community wondered if one could use the fuel lines, along with noodle rockets, to make a working claw.

This was an experiment with that idea. I didn't bother to add any "actuators"--landing legs, which can push against other parts. I just wanted to test the structural integrity of this design, given that it's intentionally not rigid.

I found it haunting, and a little disturbing. I think I lost it about five minutes in.
